reviews.text: Spent three nights here with Canadian visitors. Horrendous gales couldn't have been better for this most stunning part of the country - scenery (sea) was at it's best and there was a small break to be able to enjoy the rest of the wonderful scenery. Hotel room, restaurant, bar, staff first class. Nothing was any bother to any of the staff - a credit to the owners. Everything about this hotel was four star and will definitely be returning to enjoy the peace and tranquility offered by both the district and the hotel.
reviews.title: First class relaxation

reviews.text: I was at a wedding in this wedding recently and for such a fancy hotel I really felt the food let the place down. The starters was chucked cesar salad, it had far too much sauce and there was no chicken only lumps of ham. The main was average with over cooked veg. The dessert was a disaster the cream was nearly butter and was stale probably sitting in a fridge for at least a day. The breakfast the following morning followed the same pattern.
reviews.title: Wedding guest at this wedding food was nothing to write home about.

reviews.text: Our room was fab a pity the bathroom door wouldnt stay closed as we had sunlight in on top of us early the following morning. But the bed etc was luxurious.
reviews.title: perfect , will return again

reviews.text: Love this place and will definitely be back. Scenery fantastic. It was just what i needed quiet and peaceful as we were having a break from the kids.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: Stayed here in August with a bunch of guys from Dublin. Went to play Ballyliffin GC which was all it is made out to be...superb condition and really nice people in clubhouse bar afterwards. Hotel is probably best in Ballyliffin (I've been to the others and they are probably 2.5/3 star - they're not bad just I think this is better) and added bonus of pool and steam room etc. Rooms good. We ate in the bar as part of a 2BB1D package and the food was v good. Old style bar which gets busy with wedding parties at the weekend. Went out in Buncrana one night and the spot there is O'Flaherty's. All in all, I would stay here again for the great value package and proximity to golf course. Staff were v nice and typical of the Donegal welcome we received. 4 stars is about right for Ballyliffin Lodge.
reviews.title: Probably best hotel in Ballylifin for golfers....Golfing Heaven

reviews.text: We had a horrendous time at Ballyliffin Lodge. Sold on the 'luxury' description and with 4 stars, thought it must be quite nice. We decided to get away for one night only for a relaxing night in Donegal. In short, it was a nightmare. We will never be back and I'd advise anyone thinking of going to Ballyliffin Lodge to think again.
reviews.title: Luxury? Anything but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to find the mini bar locked. We called reception and were asked to call back down to collect a key. Nice touch. The room was okay and Ballyliffin itself is a quaint part of beautiful Inishowen. We noticed there was a wedding taking place and thought nothing until later. The food was okay and the people were pleasant.
reviews.title: Great Hotel on the Inishowen 100 Route

reviews.text: My main complaint was the noise. We spent between 2am and 5.30am wide awake, pacing the floor, pleading with the night porter to do something about the rabble downstairs. The wedding party was completely out of control. When we rang down, we were dismissed quickly and the Porter suggested he would 'try and calm things down'. Over 100 drunk people were roaring like football fans on the terraces. Frankly, it was a frightening experience and and we were appalled that a hotel that describes itself as 'luxury' seemed happy to let this behaviour continue well into early morning.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: I was in Derry on business and my suppliers had booked a dinner at this hotel with overnight accommodation and while there I decided to extend my stay for an extra night and see some of the countryside;
reviews.title: Charming Hotel in a stunning location with a superb spa

reviews.text: The room spacious and bright; the wardrobe had ample hangers, extra blankets and pillows, which weren’t needed. There was a desk to work at and another table and chairs to sit and admire the wonderful views out of the window. The bed was really comfortable and the bathroom had huge fluffy towels and a powerful shower over the bath.
reviews.title: Most relaxing hotel in beautiful part of Donegal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having looked forward to an overnight stay our first introduction was to be given a room overlooking the view of the car park. Paid an additinal 20 Euro for the ocen view. Told that the resturant times were 6.30 or 9 p.m only as a choice. Opted for the 9 p.m slot -big mistake it took an hour to be served a meal. Can not understand why this hotel has an award of 4 stars.
reviews.title: Give it a miss not worth 4 stars

reviews.text: Dont bother trying to complain they are simply not interested, better options in the area shop around not worth the cost.
reviews.title: very impressed and will definately return :-)

reviews.text: We stayed ( family of 5) here in August 2011 for 3 nights (one dinner and B&B included). At the time of the reservation the reception recommended that I consider an upgrade to a superior room for 50 euro in order to give more space for camp bed for the children. I am glad I did as the room was very large indeed with a wonderful view.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: The standard of the food in mami's bar was that good that we ate there all nights! The leisure area and pool were excellent and the kids adored the pool, unlike some pools they had floaters and toys for the children to play with and my children had a ball each day. The playgound at the beach was also beutiful and the area in general lovely.
reviews.title: hidden gem
One of the best in Inishowen...
reviews.text: I would consider myself hard to please and I was impressed and will return!
